intro: Geranium subglabrum, commonly known as the smooth geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are usually rounded or ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Geranium subglabrum is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
